content.description: A short toprope. Harder than it looks.
content.protection: TR only. Needs bolts added for leading.
content.location: Chains are up and left of arete that lies uphill of Jumpin Someone Else's Train.

content.description: A fun well-protected sport route with two distinct cruxes. For lead climbing, you may want your belayer anchored to a boulder on the ground so they don't get pulled across the scree slope.
content.location: Straight up the farthest left bolt line on the main wall. Just to the right of the 3rd class gully that leads down to the routes from the top. You can also set-up a TR on the chain anchors by reaching down from the top.

content.description: A difficult dyno crux to small holds on the start. Staying straight up at first two bolts. Easier terrain above on 5.10. Super fun route and surprisingly aesthetic clean quartzite except for start.
content.location: Just left of the farthest right arete on the main wall. A toprope can be set-up from the chains on top but not easily.

content.description: Climb through some suspect rock on the start and clip the first bolt. Stay straight up at the next 3 bolts and the route seems like a 5.11a. Trending slightly right makes the route more in the 5.10+ range. A couple of thin cruxes but well-bolted. This route might be a good route to stick clip because of suspect rock on the start.
content.location: 10 feet right of Jumping Someone Else's Train

content.description: Continual 5.11 climbing after gaining the arete. A huge dangerous block on the start of arete needs to be cleaned before this route is climbed again.
content.protection: Project; Route not completed; needs 2 more bolts added. Chains and top bolts on face are already installed. Awaits a redpoint on lead. FA is only a toprope ascent.
content.location: 20 feet right of Driver 8 Take a Break walking east on the other side of the arete. Start in a 4th class chimney on suspect rock to gain the arete. Chain anchors can easily be accessed by walking down from top across gap in big blocks.
